messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] college and vaccinations
messages.msgSnippet: I did. I refused to get vaccinated yet once again for my MA and PhD. Here in the state of NY you can sign a waiver not just for religious reasons. I can t
messages.messageBody:
I did. I refused to get vaccinated yet once again for my MA and PhD.
Here in the state of NY you can sign a waiver not just for religious
reasons. I can't remember the term but it was something akin to the
"conscientious abjector" military clause.



On Saturday, October 18, 2003, at 01:34 PM, HaHaMommy@... wrote:

> In a message dated 10-13-2003 3:52:10 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
> dpryntz@... writes:
> Anyone out there with a successful story of entering college and
> remaining
> vaccine-free?
> ************************
> I don't have a success story, but I understand you can use the
> religious
> exemption for college entry. It has been deemed unconstitutional for
> the school,
> or the government for that matter, to ask any questions regarding your
> religion.

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] college and vaccinations
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10-13-2003 3:52:10 PM Mountain Daylight Time, dpryntz@infoblvd.net writes: Anyone out there with a successful story of entering college and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10-13-2003 3:52:10 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
dpryntz@... writes:
Anyone out there with a successful story of entering college and remaining
vaccine-free?
************************
I don't have a success story, but I understand you can use the religious
exemption for college entry. It has been deemed unconstitutional for the school,
or the government for that matter, to ask any questions regarding your
religion.

diana,
The wackiest widow westriver...
"You can follow your book and your map of wars, but I'll go and follow my
kids." -- Woody Guthrie


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] college and vaccinations
messages.msgSnippet: ... I don t have one but I do know that colleges and schools have to accept the religious exemption form of your state. www.thinktwice.com has stuff on state
messages.messageBody:
Diana Pryntz wrote:

>Hi. I would love to hear from those that have chosen not to vaccine their
>children and college entry strategies. My oldest son is almost 16 and is
>getting ready to consider college. I am concerned about colleges requiring
>vaccinations. Anyone out there with a successful story of entering college
>and remaining vaccine-free?
>
>-Diana Pryntz
>
>
>
I don't have one but I do know that colleges and schools have to accept
the religious exemption form of your state.
www.thinktwice.com has stuff on state requirements for RE of vaccinations.

Shyrley

messages.subject: college and vaccinations
messages.msgSnippet: Hi. I would love to hear from those that have chosen not to vaccine their children and college entry strategies. My oldest son is almost 16 and is getting
messages.messageBody:
Hi. I would love to hear from those that have chosen not to vaccine their
children and college entry strategies. My oldest son is almost 16 and is
getting ready to consider college. I am concerned about colleges requiring
vaccinations. Anyone out there with a successful story of entering college
and remaining vaccine-free?

-Diana Pryntz
